commit_message:
Pass stack name to enable_ssh_admin workflow

Pass the stack/plan name to the enable_ssh_admin workflow, otherwise,
only the default 'overcloud' name works.

Depends-On: Ie5dbe86232c3b6a85665a9eec08ace8ba9415ea1
Change-Id: I76531c5fb36135cfd733ddb6980bf43d0295db30
Closes-Bug: #1795417
(cherry picked from commit 23f19693a522592f502226ccca6e14222e40f7ca)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 08:08:46.000000000', 'message': 'Copytruncate containerized logrotate configuration

This reimplements commit 67a7dc70f2885b7db2a42bc28c25ece0bbeba3e4.
Copytruncate becomes a default for containerized logrotate. The
solution based on signals processing becomes a mutual exclusive and
opted-out alternative to copytruncate.

As long as key deployment framework components heat-engine and
mistral-engine do not tolerate SIGHUP and drop their tasks in
progress on floor, copytruncate should be used.

There is more openstack services, like neutron-server, nova-scheduler
that cannot handle SIGHUP nicely yet.

All of that makes copytruncate a global choice for logs rotation of
containerized services as we just cannont be sure, if a service foo
*really* does correct processing of SIGHUP. We keep that option for
future in the hope things get fixed eventually.

Change-Id: Ibdad7859a389d0ff37bbf7bfd9f4c521a05a5ea1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-03 08:15:47.000000000', 'message': 'Copytruncate containerized logrotate configuration

There is more openstack services, like neutron-server, nova-scheduler

Closes-Bug: #1795411

'}, {'created': '2018-10-03 12:31:53.000000000', 'message': "Copytruncate containerized logrotate configuration

This reimplements commit 67a7dc70f2885b7db2a42bc28c25ece0bbeba3e4.
Copytruncate becomes a default for containerized logrotate. The
solution based on signals processing goes away.

As long as key deployment framework components heat-engine and
mistral-engine do not tolerate SIGHUP copytruncate should be used.

There is more openstack services, like neutron-server, nova-scheduler
that cannot handle SIGHUP nicely yet.

Nor can we fall back to that predates the containerization of services
because of the following reasons:

* We cannot and should not use the restart command in postrotate as it
  was before containerization of services. For that a container needs
  to be privileged and granted a docker socket bind-mount, which is a
  total security antipattern and defeats the very purpose of
  containerization. Things may change with future adoption of Podman
  and/or kubelet control plane though. If/when that happens, we might
  consider an option for postrotate to terminate a process with
  SIGTERM, to have the process instantly respawned via its systemd
  unit/kubelet restart policies.

* Individual services' logrotate configs worth nothing, when still
  being handled by a central logrotation container running crond. And
  it needs to remain centralized as individual containers neither do
  run crond nor contain logrotate, nor lightweight containers following
  12-factors apps recommendations should do anything like that. See
  also the spec [0] explaining the reasoning better.

All of that makes copytruncate a global choice for logs rotation of
containerized services as we just cannont be sure, if a service foo
*really* does correct processing of SIGHUP. We leave that option for
future implementation in the hope things get fixed eventually. As well
as the aforementioned systemd/kublet options.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/462900

Closes-Bug: #1795411
Related-Bug: #1276694
Change-Id: Ibdad7859a389d0ff37bbf7bfd9f4c521a05a5ea1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-10-03 12:37:20.000000000', 'message': "Copytruncate containerized logrotate configuration

Copytruncate becomes a default for containerized logrotate. The
solution based on signals processing goes away.

As long as key deployment framework components heat-engine and
mistral-engine do not tolerate SIGHUP copytruncate should be used.

There is more openstack services, like neutron-server, nova-scheduler
that cannot handle SIGHUP nicely yet.

Nor can we fall back to that predates the containerization of services
because of the following reasons:

* We cannot and should not use the restart command in postrotate as it
  was before containerization of services. For that a container needs
  to be privileged and granted a docker socket bind-mount, which is a
  total security antipattern and defeats the very purpose of
  containerization. Things may change with future adoption of Podman
  and/or kubelet control plane though. If/when that happens, we might
  consider an option for postrotate to terminate a process with
  SIGTERM, to have the process instantly respawned via its systemd
  unit/kubelet restart policies.

* Individual services' logrotate configs worth nothing, when still
  being handled by a central logrotation container running crond. And
  it needs to remain centralized as individual containers neither do
  run crond nor contain logrotate, nor lightweight containers following
  12-factors apps recommendations should do anything like that. Nor the
  host logrotate/crond can do rotation of logs for containers as we do/
  should not install required packages on the host, but only in
  containers. See also the spec [0] explaining the reasoning better.

All of that makes copytruncate a global choice for logs rotation of
containerized services as we just cannont be sure, if a service foo
*really* does correct processing of SIGHUP. We leave that option for
future implementation in the hope things get fixed eventually. As well
as the aforementioned systemd/kublet option, or the option to provide
stdout only logging [0] and let the logrotate thing go.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/462900

Closes-Bug: #1795411
Related-Bug: #1276694
Change-Id: Ibdad7859a389d0ff37bbf7bfd9f4c521a05a5ea1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Copytruncate containerized logrotate configuration

This reimplements commit 67a7dc70f2885b7db2a42bc28c25ece0bbeba3e4.
Copytruncate becomes a default for containerized logrotate. The
solution based on signals processing goes away.

As long as key deployment framework components heat-engine and
mistral-engine do not tolerate SIGHUP copytruncate should be used.

There is more openstack services, like neutron-server, nova-scheduler
that cannot handle SIGHUP nicely yet.

Nor can we fall back to that predates the containerization of services
because of the following reasons:

* We cannot and should not use the restart command in postrotate as it
  was before containerization of services. For that a container needs
  to be privileged and granted a docker socket bind-mount, which is a
  total security antipattern and defeats the very purpose of
  containerization. Things may change with future adoption of Podman
  and/or kubelet control plane though. If/when that happens, we might
  consider an option for postrotate to terminate a process with
  SIGTERM, to have the process instantly respawned via its systemd
  unit/kubelet restart policies.

* Individual services' logrotate configs worth nothing, when still
  being handled by a central logrotation container running crond. And
  it needs to remain centralized as individual containers neither do
  run crond nor contain logrotate, nor lightweight containers following
  12-factors apps recommendations should do anything like that. Nor the
  host logrotate/crond can do rotation of logs for containers as we do/
  should not install required packages on the host, but only in
  containers. See also the spec [0] explaining the reasoning better.

All of that makes copytruncate a global choice for logs rotation of
containerized services as we just cannont be sure, if a service foo
*really* does correct processing of SIGHUP. We leave that option for
future implementation in the hope things get fixed eventually. As well
as the aforementioned systemd/kublet option, or the option to provide
stdout only logging [0] and let the logrotate thing go.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/462900

Closes-Bug: #1795411
Related-Bug: #1276694
Change-Id: Ibdad7859a389d0ff37bbf7bfd9f4c521a05a5ea1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

'}, {'created': '2018-10-01 20:20:17.000000000', 'message': "Change nic driver to e1000 for CoreOS jobs

This change was created after observing a number of the CoreOS
IPA build/test jobs were exhibiting a high failure rate with
the virt-nic.

commit_message:
Change nic driver to e1000 for CoreOS jobs

This change was created after observing a number of the CoreOS
IPA build/test jobs were exhibiting a high failure rate with
the virt-nic.

Similar to the issues recently addressed in ironic's grenade
job, lets explicitly set the NIC to e1000 as that seems to be
more reliable for the CoreOS jobs.

Change-Id: I6365fe138d1b1ddc98a49f1a1da0b82d77678599

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-21 19:40:36.000000000', 'message': "Make get_allocations_for_resource_provider raise

In preparation for reshaper work, and because it's The Right Thing To
Do, this patch makes the report client's
get_allocations_for_resource_provider method stop acting like something
didn't go wrong when its placement API request fails. It now raises a
new ResourceProviderAllocationRetrievalFailed exception.

Unit tests, which were entirely absent, are added for the method.

The resource tracker's _remove_deleted_instances_allocations, which is
get_allocations_for_resource_provider's only consumer (for now, until
reshaper work starts using it) is refactored to behave the same way it
used to, which is to no-op if the placement API request fails. However,
a) we take an earlier short-circuit out of the method, which saves a
little work copying context stuff; and b) we now emit a warning log
message if the no-op is due to the new
ResourceProviderAllocationRetrievalFailed exception.

Change-Id: I020e7dc47efc79f8907b7bfb753ec779a8da69a1
"}, {'created': '2018-07-22 15:34:08.000000000', 'message': "Make get_allocations_for_resource_provider sane

In preparation for reshaper work, and because it's The Right Thing To
Do, this patch makes the report client's
get_allocations_for_resource_provider method stop acting like something
didn't go wrong when its placement API request fails. It now raises a
new ResourceProviderAllocationRetrievalFailed exception on non-200, or
PlacementAPIConnectFailure if @safe_connect returns None.

In the spirit of the aggregate and trait retrieval methods, it now
returns a namedtuple containing the provider generation as well as the
allocation information.

Unit tests, which were entirely absent, are added for the method.

The resource tracker's _remove_deleted_instances_allocations, which is
get_allocations_for_resource_provider's only consumer (for now, until
reshaper work starts using it) is refactored to behave the same way it
used to, which is to no-op if the placement API request fails. However,
a) we take an earlier short-circuit out of the method, which saves a
little work copying context stuff; and b) we now emit a warning log
message if the no-op is due to the newly-raised exceptions.

Change-Id: I020e7dc47efc79f8907b7bfb753ec779a8da69a1

"}, {'created': '2018-08-02 22:45:46.000000000', 'message': "Make get_allocations_for_resource_provider sane

In preparation for reshaper work, and because it's The Right Thing To
Do, this patch makes the report client's
get_allocations_for_resource_provider method stop acting like something
didn't go wrong when its placement API request fails. We remove the
@safe_connect decorator so it raises (a subclass of) ksa's
ClientException when something goes wrong with the API communication.
And the method now raises a new
ResourceProviderAllocationRetrievalFailed exception on non-200.

In the spirit of the aggregate and trait retrieval methods, it now
returns a namedtuple containing the provider generation as well as the
allocation information.

Unit tests, which were entirely absent, are added for the method.

The resource tracker's _remove_deleted_instances_allocations, which is
get_allocations_for_resource_provider's only consumer (for now, until
reshaper work starts using it) is refactored to behave the same way it
used to, which is to no-op if the placement API request fails. However,
a) we take an earlier short-circuit out of the method, which saves a
little work copying context stuff; and b) we now emit a warning log
message if the no-op is due to the newly-raised exceptions.

Change-Id: I020e7dc47efc79f8907b7bfb753ec779a8da69a1
"}, {'created': '2018-08-06 16:52:33.000000000', 'message': "Make get_allocations_for_resource_provider sane

In preparation for reshaper work, and because it's The Right Thing To

get_allocations_for_resource_provider method stop acting like something
didn't go wrong when its placement API request fails. We remove the
@safe_connect decorator so it raises (a subclass of) ksa's
ClientException when something goes wrong with the API communication.
And the method now raises a new
ResourceProviderAllocationRetrievalFailed exception on non-200.

In the spirit of the aggregate and trait retrieval methods, it now
returns a namedtuple containing the provider generation as well as the
allocation information.

Unit tests, which were entirely absent, are added for the method.

The resource tracker's _remove_deleted_instances_allocations, which is
get_allocations_for_resource_provider's only consumer (for now, until
reshaper work starts using it) is refactored to behave the same way it
used to, which is to no-op if the placement API request fails. However,
a) we take an earlier short-circuit out of the method, which saves a
little work copying context stuff; and b) we now emit a warning log
message if the no-op is due to the newly-raised exceptions.

Change-Id: I020e7dc47efc79f8907b7bfb753ec779a8da69a1

reshaper work starts using it) is refactored to behave the same way it
used to, which is to no-op if the placement API request fails. However,
a) we take an earlier short-circuit out of the method, which saves a
little work copying context stuff; and b) we now emit a warning log
message if the no-op is due to the newly-raised exceptions.

Change-Id: I020e7dc47efc79f8907b7bfb753ec779a8da69a1

commit_message:
Make get_allocations_for_resource_provider raise

In preparation for reshaper work, and because it's The Right Thing To
Do, this patch makes the report client's
get_allocations_for_resource_provider method stop acting like something
didn't go wrong when its placement API request fails. We remove the
@safe_connect decorator so it raises (a subclass of) ksa's
ClientException when something goes wrong with the API communication.
And the method now raises a new
ResourceProviderAllocationRetrievalFailed exception on non-200.

In the spirit of the aggregate and trait retrieval methods, it now
returns a namedtuple containing the allocation information.

Unit tests, which were entirely absent, are added for the method.

The resource tracker's _remove_deleted_instances_allocations, which is
get_allocations_for_resource_provider's only consumer (for now, until
reshaper work starts using it) is refactored to behave the same way it
used to, which is to no-op if the placement API request fails. However,
a) we take an earlier short-circuit out of the method, which saves a
little work copying context stuff; and b) we now emit a warning log
message if the no-op is due to the newly-raised exceptions.

Change-Id: I020e7dc47efc79f8907b7bfb753ec779a8da69a1

commit_message:
clean up ip_command interface

- In change I16b180a298e104f393b5f665409cdf4ba5bff203 an
  error was introduced i how _get_impl was defiend in
  os_vif/internal/command/ip/api.py. This change correct
  the error by returning a instance of the the PyRoute2
  class instead of a reference to the enclosing module.
- This change adds exists to the ip command interfece.
- This change makes the windows version also inherit from
  the ip_command abstract base class.

Closes-Bug: #1797182
Change-Id: I82377297db9e9ff7fad055dadb73864964f427d9

Port TaaS APIs to OpenStack CLI

for:-

1. Creation
2. Updation
3. Deletion

commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync

This change is a result of "make sync" for neutron-api charm.

Test changes also applied: removing an "charmhelpers/tests" sync
due to recent charm changes (see commit 8937059 for details) and
keystone auth_uri/auth_url removed from test since it has to been
checked later by functional tests.

Change-Id: I108497e50f28fc2a84e035f520fea4452edd91db

legacy-tempest-dsvm-cinder-v1.

keystone interface at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578293/.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 08:22:16.000000000', 'message': "Add fstab and rootfs options to the lxc3 updates

The fstab and rootfs options have slightly changed in lxc3 this change
updates our templtes to ensure we're using the correct option for the
LXC version found on disk.

Change-Id: Ib1c563db70f3ddbeb3a65c55e0917777b27fd41f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6405d287ec66ddb4a3181be7d6d725f5bb907412)
"}]
commit_message:
Add fstab and rootfs options to the lxc3 updates

The fstab and rootfs options have slightly changed in lxc3 this change
updates our templtes to ensure we're using the correct option for the
LXC version found on disk.

Change-Id: Ib1c563db70f3ddbeb3a65c55e0917777b27fd41f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6405d287ec66ddb4a3181be7d6d725f5bb907412)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 08:22:16.000000000', 'message': 'Update the option uts name in the machinectl template

The machinectl template was running with the legacy uts name option.
This change updates that option so that it uses the hash and major
version to update the config variable.

Change-Id: I85b5c92422116b139e447330214b2d6b5afbf948
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 89dc180ca4b7be2595f8f4c5740740bc486a80af)
'}]
commit_message:
Update the option uts name in the machinectl template

The machinectl template was running with the legacy uts name option.
This change updates that option so that it uses the hash and major
version to update the config variable.

Change-Id: I85b5c92422116b139e447330214b2d6b5afbf948
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 89dc180ca4b7be2595f8f4c5740740bc486a80af)

subject: Adds ability to reset iDRAC
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7160, 'name': 'arkady kanevsky', 'email': 'akanevsk@redhat.com', 'username': 'arkady'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10250, 'name': 'Christopher Dearborn', 'email': 'Christopher.Dearborn@dell.com', 'username': 'cdearbor'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23847, 'name': 'Richard G. Pioso', 'email': 'richard.pioso@dell.com', 'username': 'richard.pioso'}, {'_account_id': 28370, 'name': 'Mark Beierl', 'email': 'mark.beierl@canonical.com', 'username': 'mbeierl'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28370, 'date': '2018-07-04 14:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28370, 'date': '2018-07-04 14:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-07-06 19:14:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Great job on the test cases!  The only thing that I saw that I thought we should probably change is that the original code waited for 3 successful pings before checking to see if the iDRAC is ready, while this patch only waits for 2 pings.  It's not a huge issue, but we've tested extensively with 3 pings, so I would prefer to leave it as that."}, {'account_id': 28370, 'date': '2018-07-06 19:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-07-06 20:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks Mark!  Great job refactoring the code too!!!'}, {'account_id': 28370, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-07-25 20:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Looks great Mark.  Thanks for the patch!'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2018-07-27 14:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-08-11 12:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28370, 'date': '2018-08-15 16:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28370, 'date': '2018-08-15 16:05:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2018-08-15 16:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-08-17 20:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Had a couple comments...'}, {'account_id': 28370, 'date': '2018-08-30 20:24:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-09-04 20:31:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Let's remove the parameters from the wait_until_idrac_is_ready call so that it uses the defaults instead. commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Update log4j2 configuration settings

This updates the configuration settings used for the log4j2
template for Elasticsearch. The previous settings weren't
compatible with the version of Elasticsearch currently being used
(5.6.4)

I've confirmed that this patch chain resolves the issue I was seeing. Thanks Doug!"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-10 18:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Looks good, and great to have independent confirmation that it fixed a real life scenario.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-10 18:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 16:51:49.000000000', 'message': 'only override config values from command line if they are actually set

If we set defaults for the query configuration options and then pass
the namespace created by parsing the command line options to the
config object it cannot tell the difference between values set on the
command line and defaults. That means we may override settings in the
configuration file with defaults from the command line parser.

This change sets all of the defaults for command line options to None
as a sentinel value and then updates the Config class to ignore
command line option values of None. It also adds tests to verify that
we get the expected override behavior with boolean and string options.

Change-Id: I1c9ce668b5e5c372d1c861bcae6e6de05a8ebc0c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-10 16:55:15.000000000', 'message': 'only override config values from command line if they are actually set

If we set defaults for the query configuration options and then pass
the namespace created by parsing the command line options to the
config object it cannot tell the difference between values set on the
command line and defaults. That means we may override settings in the
configuration file with defaults from the command line parser.

This change sets all of the defaults for command line options to None
as a sentinel value and then updates the Config class to ignore
command line option values of None. It also adds tests to verify that
we get the expected override behavior with boolean and string options.

Change-Id: I1c9ce668b5e5c372d1c861bcae6e6de05a8ebc0c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
only override config values from command line if they are actually set

If we set defaults for the query configuration options and then pass
the namespace created by parsing the command line options to the
config object it cannot tell the difference between values set on the
command line and defaults. That means we may override settings in the
configuration file with defaults from the command line parser.

This change sets all of the defaults for command line options to None
as a sentinel value and then updates the Config class to ignore
command line option values of None. It also adds tests to verify that
we get the expected override behavior with boolean and string options.

Change-Id: I1c9ce668b5e5c372d1c861bcae6e6de05a8ebc0c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Rather than testing that we log a message, place the handling in its
own method and verify that we call that. This allows us to change the
logging in the configuration class without counting messages and
updating the test.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
refactor handling of missing config files for better testing

Rather than testing that we log a message, place the handling in its
own method and verify that we call that. This allows us to change the
logging in the configuration class without counting messages and
updating the test.

Change-Id: Ic3067d8ab6699ceb82db7dd64f892a757f5cc12f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-10-10 17:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-10-10 17:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-10 18:05:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 17:03:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add link to gating docs from gate pipeline description

There is confusion around why jobs that have already passed are
restarted after a gate reset. There has also been some confusion around
jobs not starting for inactive changes outside of the gate window.
Attempt to address some of this by explicitly linking the gating docs
for zuul from the gate pipeline description which will show up in the
Zuul Status page UI.

Change-Id: Id2451c813f5e5ea6595a3375f83ae9b49ca8dcd2
'}]
commit_message:
Add link to gating docs from gate pipeline description

There is confusion around why jobs that have already passed are
restarted after a gate reset. There has also been some confusion around
jobs not starting for inactive changes outside of the gate window.
Attempt to address some of this by explicitly linking the gating docs
for zuul from the gate pipeline description which will show up in the
Zuul Status page UI.

Change-Id: Id2451c813f5e5ea6595a3375f83ae9b49ca8dcd2

commit_message:
SSH to node before validating services.

Having reply on SSH's port doesn't mean system is fully up
and user can log in.
To be sure system is up-n-running ssh to machine and run command
there.
Adjust syntx for 'jq' call.

Change-Id: I59387b201486fbc4c32c4146366881635ddca544
(cherry picked from commit 204787bfd6f0faba7a2ad799404ac4fac3cb0f9a)
(cherry picked from commit aca16b0d84962e5bb7d176c0abea2f78226952a8)

commit_message:
Do not include ceph-ansible in the container image.

Instead, ceph-ansible should be installed as a THT dependency and
the mistral container mount the playbooks from the hosting node,
like it happens for other modules.

Change-Id: I1a6e18a9200b9b076221b37e552194966f3ad731
Depends-On: I8d1db69d520da069099f919f286e6a553dd645a5
Related-Bug: 1794027

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 08:30:45.000000000', 'message': "Removing the fullstack tests

As discussed on the IRC meeting [1], these tests have no value and are
100% failing all the time now.
Additionally in the stadium requirements [2] there's no requirement to
have these tests.

It makes no sense to keep them as such.

Additionally, networking_odl/tests/contrib directory is removed.
At first glance it contained mentions of fullstack which needed updated,
but upon further research it was found that the files in it weren't used
so it's removed altogether.

[1] https://meetings.opendaylight.org/opendaylight-neutron/2018/weekly_meeting/opendaylight-neutron-weekly_meeting.2018-07-30-15.03.txt
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/stadium/governance.html#when-is-a-project-considered-part-of-the-stadium

Change-Id: I0c78abb3157a7813b87de168bfb39cab2e56d725

commit_message:
Removing the fullstack tests

As discussed on the IRC meeting [1], these tests have no value and are
100% failing all the time now.
Additionally in the stadium requirements [2] there's no requirement to
have these tests.

It makes no sense to keep them as such.

Additionally, networking_odl/tests/contrib directory is removed.
At first glance it contained mentions of fullstack which needed updated,
but upon further research it was found that the files in it weren't used
so it's removed altogether.

[1] https://meetings.opendaylight.org/opendaylight-neutron/2018/weekly_meeting/opendaylight-neutron-weekly_meeting.2018-07-30-15.03.txt
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/stadium/governance.html#when-is-a-project-considered-part-of-the-stadium

Change-Id: I0c78abb3157a7813b87de168bfb39cab2e56d725
(cherry picked from commit 2e6f60ccabf4379cf4db3362889438b42e0959c9)

commit_message:
Remove obsolete publish-to-pypi-{neutron,horizon}

These are not needed anymore, remove them.

Also, remove required projects from
publish-openstack-python-branch-tarball, these are not needed anymore
either.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 01:50:37.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-container-image-prepare add --log-file

In order to centralise logging to a single file, this script needs to
support a log file argument to write to.

This change also adds timestamps to log entries, and adds a --dry-run
option which is useful for manual testing.

Change-Id: Id4b776de808ea329a299430078c6f3efdb604e02
Partial-Bug: #1789871

commit_message:
tripleo-container-image-prepare add --log-file

In order to centralise logging to a single file, this script needs to
support a log file argument to write to.

This change also adds timestamps to log entries, and adds a --dry-run
option which is useful for manual testing.

Change-Id: Id4b776de808ea329a299430078c6f3efdb604e02
Partial-Bug: #1789871

commit_message:
API _get_impl() for Linux should return PyRoute2() object

In [1], the function "_get_impl()" should return an instante
of os_vif.internal.command.ip.linux.impl_pyroute2.PyRoute2 class,
instead of returning the module itself.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/blob/master/os_vif/internal/command/ip/api.py#L28

Closes-Bug: #1797182
Change-Id: I22820784af33da5280f8603ba8736ea245fea883

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 03:19:04.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Iccbd680731592abab4980a51aa97c60d6ef95005
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Iccbd680731592abab4980a51aa97c60d6ef95005

subject: [ci] Fix checking cleanup
messages: [{'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-10-10 10:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-10-10 13:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-10-10 15:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 10:17:34.000000000', 'message': "[ci] Fix checking cleanup

Long time ago we added a special script which makes a dump of available
resources before Rally launch and compares it to what we have after
executing all workloads.

Since cleanup issues relate to Rally code itself, it is fair to fail CI
jobs only for our project and print warning at other projects' CI.

Unfortunately, after moving OpenStack relasted plugins to the separate
repository, we forgot to fix the check which identifies the type of
job.

Change-Id: I760d49a5f50eb223198f6e507e01c1a27d58c745
"}, {'created': '2018-10-10 13:31:59.000000000', 'message': "[ci] Fix checking cleanup

Long time ago we added a special script which makes a dump of available
resources before Rally launch and compares it to what we have after
executing all workloads.

Since cleanup issues relate to Rally code itself, it is fair to fail CI
jobs only for our project and print warning at other projects' CI.

Unfortunately, after moving OpenStack relasted plugins to the separate
repository, we forgot to fix the check which identifies the type of
job.

Change-Id: I760d49a5f50eb223198f6e507e01c1a27d58c745
"}]
commit_message:
[ci] Fix checking cleanup

Long time ago we added a special script which makes a dump of available
resources before Rally launch and compares it to what we have after
executing all workloads.

Since cleanup issues relate to Rally code itself, it is fair to fail CI
jobs only for our project and print warning at other projects' CI.

Unfortunately, after moving OpenStack relasted plugins to the separate
repository, we forgot to fix the check which identifies the type of
job.

Change-Id: I760d49a5f50eb223198f6e507e01c1a27d58c745

Note that ocata is in extended maintenance, so I don't believe we'll be doing any more releases on this branch. Downstream consumers can build packages based on it though."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 22:12:29.000000000', 'message': 'Reverse role of synchronous_reader

Repaired the "synchronous_reader" modifier of enginefacade so that it
refers to the "writer" engine when set to True, thereby allowing
"synchronous" behavior with the writer.  When set to False, this is
"asynchronous", so this should be associated with the async engines.
The flag had the reverse behavior previously.

Change-Id: Id7fea7562ba90eb710176d497af103303f230531
Closes-bug: #1746116
'}]
commit_message:
Reverse role of synchronous_reader

Repaired the "synchronous_reader" modifier of enginefacade so that it
refers to the "writer" engine when set to True, thereby allowing
"synchronous" behavior with the writer.  When set to False, this is
"asynchronous", so this should be associated with the async engines.
The flag had the reverse behavior previously.

Change-Id: Id7fea7562ba90eb710176d497af103303f230531
Closes-bug: #1746116

commit_message:
Specification for extending provider driver library

This specification is for adding a new provider driver library function.
The function will give providers an ability to get fully populated
LB graph from any provider data model object received as a parameter
from octavi controller API call.
This function preserves the functional neutron-lbaas backward compatebility
which allows provider drivers to get full LB graph on any API call.

Implements Story: 1655768

Change-Id: Ic3ec73846e58dc40282cdd279d2e3577e6918e71

commit_message:
OVH GRA1 Maintenance 2018-10-10 1900 UTC

OVH is performing cloud upgrades which requires API outages.
For GRA1: The maintenance period is 2018-10-10 starting at 1900UTC and
ending at 0000UTC the 2018-10-11. This changes sets max servers to 0 so
that we do not notice this maintenance on our end.

commit_message:
Add ability to configure backend availability zones

Add new "backend_availability_zone" parameter to every volume
backend. The parameters are optional, and when set they override the
DEFAULT/storage_availability_zone for the corresponding backend.

Implements: blueprint split-controlplane-cinder-volume-az
Change-Id: I11821a38d8ba5afc594b3d601cd1634207a6f093

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-10 16:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-10-10 16:18:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I'm sure we've crossed wires here and/or this seems confusing, but I don't think we need to deprecate this. It's built and not costing us anything in maintenance.

I don't think it's the best way to do things, just like I said when we landed this in the first place. But, it's _a_ way, and it's the closest thing to restoring the original behavior of nova, which is that compute nodes can self-register and be used automatically. I'd prefer that people build a discovery call into their config management so that they don't need this. Tripleo and ironic couldn't do that because of the additional timing wrinkle of when ironic nodes show up compared to when nova provisioning is done, although they now can skirt that with --by-service. But that doesn't mean this isn't a useful thing for some people in some scenarios."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-10 16:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/609346/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 59m 13s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-10 16:33:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
docs: Don't configure '[scheduler] discover_hosts_in_cells_interval'

This option has essentially been superseded by the '--by-service' flag
for the 'nova-manage discover_hosts' command. As such, we should not be
recommending users use this option in our documentation.

Change-Id: I4e85d45cfeb30aad9e852c8dbc1f58183155b06d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1755602

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 03:11:26.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I60a754d28ca56fb7f995d0af5c03a7734c5ba8b1
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I60a754d28ca56fb7f995d0af5c03a7734c5ba8b1

commit_message:
Fix list concatenation of routes in bond-with-vlan

We are passing a list of routes to concatenate. This list
was nested in another list, causing an invalid configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1793838
Change-Id: I7a8bc5d2171905237fe36d5ccad853f838c9bffc

commit_message:
Tag openshift images for Infra service

This commit updates the container image services after we've split the
infra service from the master one.

This also fixes missing Worker service for
DockerOpenShiftDeployerImage.

Change-Id: Ibc98e699d34dc6ab9ff6dce0d41f275b6403d983
(cherry picked from commit 0442e4fe41d31a4ccc870ded6133c14abefd098e)

commit_message:
Accept lists in pci-alias charm config

Allow json lists to be passed in via the pci-alias charm config
option so that multiple aliases can be set.

Increase amulet timeout due to gate failures

Change-Id: I3b5ea70224536f8d40f9c04482fa676c2b230bdd
Partial-Bug: #1735205

commit_message:
Add support for distro and major release delineation

We'll need unique release files for
CentOS-7, CentOS-8, Fedora-28 and RHEL

Change-Id: I5613d1acb2925a1066623665f0598a060c97acee
Partial-Bug: #1740928
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/1

For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2016-01-14 07:15:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Even if this is currently checked at the proxy level - I think it should be kept in the object server too. Someone might use the object server without the proxy (yes, that's happening - even in Swift itself, for example when using the dispersion tools), so checking again makes sense to me. Also, the checks don't require a lot of resources - it's mostly headers and content length that is checked."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 05:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 07:42:21.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I15775f36d0fbba05c5493037b389f7dc363a049e
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I15775f36d0fbba05c5493037b389f7dc363a049e

commit_message:
Check for server in attachements when checking for detach complete

It's possible that the volume is already attached to another
server, which can happen by marking a  VolumeAttachment resource
unhealthy after removing the volume from the server.

Change-Id: Ia77e0462bf732224b491591d22584cbcfa779956
Story: #2003850
Task: 26643
(cherry picked from commit 3b59f9ad98427ea152e0d55397d102998883d429)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-25 08:13:04.000000000', 'message': '[Queens/Pike] Run online data migrations on converge, allow disabling them

We control whether online migrations run or not via a new parameter
EnableOnlineDataMigrations. The online data migrations get
automatically disabled for the main upgrade phase, and automatically
enabled on upgrade converge.

This means that if no manual override is done, the migrations will run
on `upgrade converge` automatically. However, user is still able to
override the EnableOnlineDataMigrations, to e.g. completely opt out of
running the migrations automatically, if they wish to run them by
hand.

This patch is a "spiritual backport" of change
I35c8d9985df21b3084fba558687e1f408e5a0878, which is not backportable
further back than Rocky.

Change-Id: Ife468bc86b4b2c415783f37ff8ef2f90a4c0e465
Partial-Bug: #1793332
(cherry picked from commit 218ff2a50e411689f26ee78213e280cd7f6d9dd4)
'}]
commit_message:
[Queens/Pike] Run online data migrations on converge, allow disabling them

We control whether online migrations run or not via a new parameter
EnableOnlineDataMigrations. The online data migrations get
automatically disabled for the main upgrade phase, and automatically
enabled on upgrade converge.

This means that if no manual override is done, the migrations will run
on `upgrade converge` automatically. However, user is still able to
override the EnableOnlineDataMigrations, to e.g. completely opt out of
running the migrations automatically, if they wish to run them by
hand.

This patch is a "spiritual backport" of change
I35c8d9985df21b3084fba558687e1f408e5a0878, which is not backportable
further back than Rocky.

Change-Id: Ife468bc86b4b2c415783f37ff8ef2f90a4c0e465
Partial-Bug: #1793332
(cherry picked from commit 218ff2a50e411689f26ee78213e280cd7f6d9dd4)

[{'created': '2018-10-04 17:22:39.000000000', 'message': "Don't ignore SIGPIPE

By default Python configures SIGPIPE to be SIG_IGN, which means to
ignore the signal. We don't want that as it causes problems when
journald restarts and our log calls start triggering SIGPIPEs.
Instead, we want to allow the SIGPIPE to kill the process so it can
be restarted by systemd.

Change-Id: I512139b96b2de8b372efc91e8a3fc8d33553405a
Closes-Bug: 1795030
(cherry picked from commit 4fa30ae5d766c99ad27f74911b0456d06c474df3)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't ignore SIGPIPE

By default Python configures SIGPIPE to be SIG_IGN, which means to
ignore the signal. We don't want that as it causes problems when
journald restarts and our log calls start triggering SIGPIPEs.
Instead, we want to allow the SIGPIPE to kill the process so it can
be restarted by systemd.

Change-Id: I512139b96b2de8b372efc91e8a3fc8d33553405a
Closes-Bug: 1795030
(cherry picked from commit 4fa30ae5d766c99ad27f74911b0456d06c474df3)

commit_message:
Implements: ceph/rbd utility script

This is an effort to implement ceph and rbd utility.
This utilities can be used to perform ceph/rbd operations without
having to drop into container shell using kubectl exec

Change-Id: Ibd044554203dd21446123115a68ec4157a2bc66a
Signed-off-by: Sreejith Punnapuzha <Sreejith.Punnapuzha@outlook.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-28 15:12:09.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore forcing of evacuation for nested instance

In the baseline during forced evacuaton nova blindy copied the
source allocation from the source compute RP to the destination compute
RP. When the instance has nested allocaton on the source host this blind
copy cannot be done any more as nova only knows the destination compute RP
but not the nested RPs on the destination compute to copy the instance
allocation.

This patch proposes to ignore the force flag if the instance being
evacuated has nested allocation on the source host. By ignoring the force
flag conductor will call the scheduler to verify the destination host
provided and the scheduler will query allocation candidates from
placement restricted to the destination host for such validation. This
way scheduler can do the nested claim on the destination host.

This patch changes the behavior of force evacuate as now it can return
NoValidHost if the provided host is invalid from placement or
scheduler perspective.

TODO:
* Add a functional test case when the evacuation happens from a flat
  compute to a reshaped nested compute to verify that the migration
  fails gracefully
* Make unit test pass

Change-Id: If85cc0175002f9c7942b2e2a435b5262673c18ce
Blueprint: use-nested-allocation-candidates

commit_message:
Ignore forcing of evacuation for nested instance

In the baseline during forced evacuaton nova blindy copied the
source allocation from the source compute RP to the destination compute
RP. When the instance has nested allocaton on the source host this blind
copy cannot be done any more as nova only knows the destination compute RP
but not the nested RPs on the destination compute to copy the instance
allocation.

This patch proposes to ignore the force flag if the instance being
evacuated has nested allocation on the source host. By ignoring the force
flag conductor will call the scheduler to verify the destination host
provided and the scheduler will query allocation candidates from
placement restricted to the destination host for such validation. This
way scheduler can do the nested claim on the destination host.

This patch changes the behavior of force evacuate as now it can return
NoValidHost if the provided host is invalid from placement or
scheduler perspective.

This patch also fixes a bug. When _allocate_for_evacuate_dest_host
raises NoValidHost the migration wasn't put in error state but was left
it in accepted state. This patch makes sure that the migration is put to
error state.

Change-Id: If85cc0175002f9c7942b2e2a435b5262673c18ce
Blueprint: use-nested-allocation-candidates

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 20:54:39.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I7a5fcd7ae9686cae1ab5f588b4c58ff3533b2e0f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I7a5fcd7ae9686cae1ab5f588b4c58ff3533b2e0f

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.29

This patch:
- updates all the roles to the latest available stable SHAs
- copies the release notes from the updated roles into the integrated repo
- updates all the OpenStack Service SHAs

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/607844

commit_message:
Disable nested virt

It looks like OpenSUSE and CentOS are getting failures
when running with nested virt on other providers. Let's
just get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ifae3425b66254aa655df5b6bb95896da1cccc32a
(cherry picked from commit e1aabd05b85cac3b931f01f547083ec8930eed16)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 21:17:56.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I42acef2bb94c3950f2b06d41352b15c788826f45
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I42acef2bb94c3950f2b06d41352b15c788826f45

commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync

This change is a result of "make sync" for neutron-openvswitch charm.
Also, removing an "charmhelpers/tests" sync due to recent charm changes
(see commit 8daeaada for details).

Change-Id: I0f06bf2371d4ae57d0051406b11db19202a4c6df

[{'created': '2018-09-26 15:27:00.000000000', 'message': 'Volume discovery minimum 3.43 api version

Set the volume api version to 3.43 to make
sure we get 3.41 change where it exposes
the user_id for snapshots.

This will fix the volume.snapshot.size metric
that is not working when trying to access the
user_id throws a AttributeError.

Change-Id: I2414717e7c9e64b0092fe93c97a062a48dbf09a8
Closes-Bug: 1794475
'}]
commit_message:
Volume discovery minimum 3.43 api version

Set the volume api version to 3.43 to make
sure we get 3.41 change where it exposes
the user_id for snapshots.

This will fix the volume.snapshot.size metric
that is not working when trying to access the
user_id throws a AttributeError.

Change-Id: I2414717e7c9e64b0092fe93c97a062a48dbf09a8
Closes-Bug: 1794475

[{'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-07 03:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-07 03:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-07 14:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-07 16:50:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-07 16:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-07 17:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-09-07 19:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- rally-dsvm-tox-functional: unrecognized error
- rally-tox-cover: unrecognized error
- rally-tox-pep8: unrecognized error
- rally-tox-py27: unrecognized error
- rally-tox-py35: unrecognized error
- rally-tox-py36: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1449136
- rally-tox-py37: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-07 19:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-07 22:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-08 02:27:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-08 12:57:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-08 13:32:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-08 16:37:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

@Andrey, can you help me understand what's wrong with the patch?"}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-09-10 14:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

hi Sai!
It is sad to see that our error message is useless :( Will work on fixing it.

http://logs.openstack.org/33/600633/11/check/rally-tox-py27/e0ee391/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-09-08_13_38_04_361216

this message tries to say that `trunk: -1` argument (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/600633/11/samples/tasks/scenarios/neutron/create-and-list-trunks.yaml) is unknown for quotas context. You can extend it here - https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally_openstack/contexts/quotas/neutron_quotas.py#L19'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-17 18:15:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-17 18:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-18 16:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-18 20:18:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-09-18 23:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-09-21 14:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

hey! The code of new plugins looks good to me, just several things I want to see as well:

1) Can you update changelog? https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/CHANGELOG.rst#added
2) It would be nice to include a new plugin to rally-task-neutron job. Note: neutron-trunk service should be enabled. see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558037/6/.zuul.yaml
3) After merging this patch, we will have plugins name conflict with in-tree neutron plugins. There is nothing awful in it since neutron in-tree plugins will silently fail to load and new ones will be used instead, but we need to remove them from neutron tree to avoid misleading or the proper check should be added like https://xsnippet.org/363880'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-10-02 16:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-10-02 16:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

1. Done
2. Can you explain what this means, I don;t fully understand.
3. You mean remove this?
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/rally-jobs/plugins/trunk_scenario.py'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-10-05 17:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-10-08 13:55:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

hi Sai!

> 2. Can you explain what this means, I don;t fully understand.

Sure. Sorry for not clear comment last time.
We are trying to check all the plugins in our CI to ensure that they are not broken by the random change (release of client library or so). 
We have rally-task-neutron job which checks most of neutron related plugins. It would be nice to extend it's task (https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally-jobs/neutron.yaml) to run the new scenario plugin as well. As far as I know, to check neutron trunks they should be enabled first in devstack. Here is a config for this job - https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/.zuul.d/rally-task-neutron.yaml

> 3. You mean remove this?

There are 2 options. One of it - just remove the module https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/rally-jobs/plugins/trunk_scenario.py . Another one - update it, so 'TrunkLifeCycle' class will not be recognized as Rally plugin for the releases which doesn't include it."}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-10-08 13:57:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-10-08 20:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2018-10-08 20:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Andrey, I think removing the plugin in neutron tree and maintaining it in rally-openstack is best. But if I submit a patch to neutron to remove the plugin, and if latest version of rally with neutron trunk ports scenarios is not available in some rally-openstack version is that a problem? Or is it enough to have the neutron trunk scenario merge in rally-openstack master? Hope my question makes sense, if not I can rephrase.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-10-09 10:55:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Published edit on patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-10-10 09:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-10-10 11:06:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Published edit on patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-10-10 13:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add RHELRegistrationActions to rhel-registration template

This can be used in the case where e.g a satellite has been added
after the initial deployment to re-register the nodes with the
satellite, even those nodes that already exist.

Change-Id: I944bc4c65b08de1ca08dd91f55764ebfe141dd9c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-28 17:01:04.000000000', 'message': 'Stop encoding "~" in query parameters

IETF RFC 3986 classifies "~" as a reserved character [1],
however until python3.7 [2], python's url parsing
used to encode this character.

urllib has seen a lot of churn in various python
releases, and hence we were using a six wrapper
to shield ourselves, however, this backwards-incompatible
change in encoding norms forces us to deal with
the problem at our end.

Manila's API accepts "~" in both, its encoded
or un-encoded forms. So, let's stop encoding it
within manilaclient, regardless of the version
of python running it.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986.html
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/urllib.parse.html#url-quoting

Closes-Bug: #1785283
Change-Id: I6df5d543ae94ed1fa966c8019a52e9fca19e387e
'}, {'created': '2018-08-28 17:32:00.000000000', 'message': 'Stop encoding "~" in query parameters

IETF RFC 3986 classifies "~" as a reserved character [1],
however until python3.7 [2], python's url parsing
used to encode this character.

urllib has seen a lot of churn in various python
releases, and hence we were using a six wrapper
to shield ourselves, however, this backwards-incompatible
change in encoding norms forces us to deal with
the problem at our end.

Manila's API accepts "~" in both, its encoded
or un-encoded forms. So, let's stop encoding it
within manilaclient, regardless of the version
of python running it.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986.html
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/urllib.parse.html#url-quoting

Closes-Bug: #1785283
Change-Id: I6df5d543ae94ed1fa966c8019a52e9fca19e387e

'}, {'created': '2018-10-09 00:16:12.000000000', 'message': 'Stop encoding "~" in query parameters

IETF RFC 3986 classifies "~" as a reserved character [1],
however until python3.7 [2], python's url parsing
used to encode this character.

urllib has seen a lot of churn in various python
releases, and hence we were using a six wrapper
to shield ourselves, however, this backwards-incompatible
change in encoding norms forces us to deal with
the problem at our end.

Manila's API accepts "~" in both, its encoded
or un-encoded forms. So, let's stop encoding it
within manilaclient, regardless of the version
of python running it.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986.html
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/urllib.parse.html#url-quoting

Closes-Bug: #1785283
Change-Id: I6df5d543ae94ed1fa966c8019a52e9fca19e387e
'}]
commit_message:
Stop encoding "~" in query parameters

IETF RFC 3986 classifies "~" as a reserved character [1],
however until python3.7 [2], python's url parsing
used to encode this character.

urllib has seen a lot of churn in various python
releases, and hence we were using a six wrapper
to shield ourselves, however, this backwards-incompatible
change in encoding norms forces us to deal with
the problem at our end.

Manila's API accepts "~" in both, its encoded
or un-encoded forms. So, let's stop encoding it
within manilaclient, regardless of the version
of python running it.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986.html
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/urllib.parse.html#url-quoting

Closes-Bug: #1785283
Change-Id: I6df5d543ae94ed1fa966c8019a52e9fca19e387e

[{'created': '2018-07-04 10:41:28.000000000', 'message': 'Allow checking for redirects in our tests

There is an open bug in tempest[0] that makes checking for redirects
impossible because the http client is set up to follow redirects
automatically. We work around this by copying the http client definition
from tempest and patching it locally with modified redirect parameters.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1616892

Change-Id: I5a584fc1e0b50b0cf94503a105e05191a63e3ed1
'}]
commit_message:
Allow checking for redirects in our tests

There is an open bug in tempest[0] that makes checking for redirects
impossible because the http client is set up to follow redirects
automatically. We work around this by copying the http client definition
from tempest and patching it locally with modified redirect parameters.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1616892

Change-Id: I5a584fc1e0b50b0cf94503a105e05191a63e3ed1

commit_message:
Optimize and enhance the code of "test_routers.py"

Most of test cases under "test_routers.py" are not using base network
class method but instead of that creating their own methods.
So this patch will enhance the code and will use the base network class
methods.

Change-Id: I65b17d1b421a8095e89d7acd27d07835903c5d87

commit_message:
MNAIO: Add supported distro check and remove trusty support

Ubuntu Trusty is too old to support much of what this tooling does,
so we remove support for it and add a task to verify that a supported
distribution version is being used.

Change-Id: I0247be130dd4adf1d1d50518e6ec5c617a3a8f7c

commit_message:
Remove now obsolete required-repos

With the change to python release and tarball jobs, we do not use
tox venv anymore. Thus, we can remove all required-projects for
these jobs. Since these jobs are part of the standard templates, we can
remove the job including the required-projects list.

Change-Id: I2680fbba8837431d6af34f177fa9524b6c4c7627

commit_message:
Remove usage of tox -e venv from release job

The newer pti-python-tarball playbooks do not use tox -e venv anymore
but call python setup.py directly. We can use these for all release
and tarball jobs and simplify them. This allows to remove installing
extra required projects or setting up a constraints file.

Remove now unused playbooks.

Change-Id: Ia1bc5d7715d4b8117d1d99c3415e5af88d902ced

commit_message:
Update publish-to-pypi-neutron

The publish-to-pypi jobs installs neutron, there's no need anymore
for publish-to-pypi-neutron, remove usage of the template.
We can safely replace this with publish-to-pypi-python3 since
that does not use tox for installation.

Change-Id: I4b4702af52a9eda114a8b6780b2b63bfd3ead7ca

commit_message:
Convert some more repos to publish-to-pypi-python3

A couple of repos under governance were forgotten to convert to use
publish-to-pypi-python3 in change
I0aad9581908c28d0012039fe6c4cc89e6e62efae, update them.

Change-Id: I5c755562f13bfb3435229b24b10d4ed5661a0911

[{'created': '2018-10-04 15:59:45.000000000', 'message': "Mark the Nexenta Edge driver unsupported

The Nexenta Edge 3rd Party CI hasn't reported
on successfully on a patch in over 4 months.  This
falls outside the CI requirements for Cinder so the
driver is being marked unsupported.  If the CI isn't
fixed the driver will be removed in the 'T' release.

Change-Id: If6d5f09865835e06b11961911246d72eac769a46
"}]
commit_message:
Mark the Nexenta Edge driver unsupported

The Nexenta Edge 3rd Party CI hasn't reported
on successfully on a patch in over 4 months.  This
falls outside the CI requirements for Cinder so the
driver is being marked unsupported.  If the CI isn't
fixed the driver will be removed in the 'T' release.

Change-Id: If6d5f09865835e06b11961911246d72eac769a46

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 15:21:56.000000000', 'message': "Mark the Tintri driver unsupported

The Tintri 3rd Party CI system hasn't reported
in almost 4 months.  This doens't meet Cinder's
3rd Party CI requirements so the driver is being marked
unsupported.  It will be removed in the 'T' release
if the problem isn't resolved.

Change-Id: I8cf2bc860dceff1d4041ac02812beb688e6dee36
"}]
commit_message:
Mark the Tintri driver unsupported

The Tintri 3rd Party CI system hasn't reported
in almost 4 months.  This doens't meet Cinder's
3rd Party CI requirements so the driver is being marked
unsupported.  It will be removed in the 'T' release
if the problem isn't resolved.

Change-Id: I8cf2bc860dceff1d4041ac02812beb688e6dee36

commit_message:
Remove sg_scan

Brick was moved to os-brick so remove sg_scan
from rootwrap and associated documentation.

Change-Id: I56d67ebd24f3af74f26100b2d8fba3868b1acdbb
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

The request/response parameters for the v2 os-quota-sets API

reference is copied from the compute API and is therefore wrong

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v2/#quota-sets-extension-os-quota-sets

commit_message:
API-REF:os-quota-sets v2 API reference has the wrong parameters

The request/response parameters for the v2 os-quota-sets API
reference is copied from the compute API and is therefore wrong
for the block storage API:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v2/#quota-sets-extension-os-quota-sets

This patch replaces the wrong response with the correct parameters.

Change-Id: I6df1d60843943c99505a735a6dec4f47270a1c2e
Closes-Bug: #1794125

commit_message:
add a script to randomly assign TC members as liaisons

This script reads the TC liaison assignments from the wiki and fills
in the gaps by randomly assigning members to work with teams.

Change-Id: I1d7eaad0e78fd020472fa560f08b5e7bfb9028b5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I8a6977b481ab0df1ef422c61d196e3b7eb962fe3

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Idcd18d1cbed5db5538812cc5c225b5ef7ddcc893

Update cinder packages name for Fedora and RedHat > 7

are now available at [1].

commit_message:
Use store_true action for attachment cli

Use store_true action to replace the way to input
'True' or 'False'.
Remove bool_from_string for args.connect.

Change-Id: I35a2c60599b79df591071bc8c1e84feb0cdb9747

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 08:17:25.000000000', 'message': 'Update all SHAs for 17.1.3

This patch:
- updates all the roles to the latest available stable SHAs
- copies the release notes from the updated roles into the integrated repo
- updates all the OpenStack Service SHAs

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/607827
Change-Id: Iec9cba2546ced6ce858fcff572dbf50076db8a5e

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 17.1.3

This patch:
- updates all the roles to the latest available stable SHAs
- copies the release notes from the updated roles into the integrated repo
- updates all the OpenStack Service SHAs

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/607827
Change-Id: Iec9cba2546ced6ce858fcff572dbf50076db8a5e

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-10-10 10:31:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Check logs, Gena:

{1} kuryr_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.test_port_pool.TestPortPoolScenario.test_port_pool [71.725609s] ... FAILED

Could you check that out? ;)'}, {'account_id': 21302, 'date': '2018-10-10 10:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The tests that should run on the gate this patch was created for are in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603121/, so the existing test that worked before can fail if some other tests run before it'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-10-10 11:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm fine with this for now, but in the future please try to address this in the opposite way, i.e.

Gate patch would depend on test patch so we could check it that way.

I'm aware both approaches work, but I think it'd be clearer doing it like that."}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-10-10 11:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-10-10 11:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

commit_message:
Remove parameter reference to non-exisingt parameter

The ControlPlaneRoutes parameter referenced in
network/config/bond-with-vlans/role.role.j2.yaml does
not exist.

commit_message:
Add tests for multiattach check in cinder.objects

There doesn't exists a test for multiattach check in the
cinder.tests.unit.objects.test_volume_types.TestVolumeType class.
This patch adds the respective tests.

Change-Id: Ic6c19414738367aa794522aaa0c1a963abcac723

In this case, the controllers are not reachable from public network.

commit_message:
support WEBSSO_KEYSTONE_URL

Add a new optional WEBSSO_KEYSTONE_URL property to facilitate WEBSSO
deployments where network segmentation is used per security requirement.
In this case, the controllers are not reachable from public network.
Therefore, user's browser will not be able to reach OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL
if it is set to the internal endpoint.

If WEBSSO_KEYSTONE_URL is set, it will be used instead of
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL.

Change-Id: I05ea4227aa4c2cb0a73015ed7fd29cf1a96e696a
Closes-bug: #1544703

commit_message:
Enable support for security group logging

Add support to enabling logging of security groups for
OpenStack Queens or later; this feature is enabled via
the neutron-api charm, with local charm configuration
options to allow control of rate and burst limits and to
set a local log output directory if require (allowing log
data to be written to a separate partition for example).

The feature is only compatible with the openvswitch firewall
driver and will not be enabled if this configuration option
is not set.

Basic deployment tests changes is included here since
nova-cloud-controller unit and relation was missing before,
and it leads to CI constantly failing.

Corresponding charm-helpers change:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/228

Change-Id: Id6ed09f714981e87838186d51a4f5e693bedb1d3
Closes-Bug: #1787397
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/602355

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated RamFilter from NFV environment files

RamFilter is deprecated in nova. And custom resource class is being
used for scheduling baremetal nodes. This patch removes all occurrences
of RamFilter in the NFV environment files.

Change-Id: Ie6355af42ed529844eead5d93cc323b093a03299

[{'created': '2018-10-10 09:55:59.000000000', 'message': 'Convert step to int for comparison in boot-params-service

step variable in deploy_steps_playbook is provided as int for
step 0 and string for all other steps. Fix the comparison in

Change-Id: Iad4710f945fbe33b012654025fe760d7cfc47d9e

commit_message:
Convert step to int for comparison in boot-params-service

step variable in deploy_steps_playbook is provided as int for
step 0 and string for all other steps. Fix the comparison in
boot-params-service tasks to convert to int, so that it works
for both types.
Closes-Bug: #1797096

Change-Id: Iad4710f945fbe33b012654025fe760d7cfc47d9e

This job is continually broken and just eats up resources. Let's remove

commit_message:
Honor blacklist with enable_ssh_admin

Use the stack output BlacklistedIpAddresses in the enable_ssh_admin
workflow so that the workflow does not use any of the servers in the
blacklist.

Change-Id: Ie5dbe86232c3b6a85665a9eec08ace8ba9415ea1
Depends-On: Ie96acf29a857e4801f5823f26a7de6bc989f39e2
Closes-Bug: #1785680
(cherry picked from commit 893cd2af3fb9e804e7dac3dd34b27be3cc63e5aa)

commit_message:
Fix commit 14a2995

Original commit added incorrect config section [heat_clients]
which should actually be [clients_heat].

Also adds workaround for bug 1750395 which affects creation
of server without specifying network (>= rocky). This is needed
for amulet tests to pass.

Change-Id: I8f1036bd8797a336d836a6b3f6fa9cb50f7a8fa8
Closes-Bug: #1770144

messages: [{'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2018-10-09 21:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-10-10 08:28:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 21:11:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I5cf12e8db1bbf6215ad67524b80ad52e8b9eff4d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I5cf12e8db1bbf6215ad67524b80ad52e8b9eff4d

commit_message:
Enable support for security group logging

Add support to enable logging of security groups for
OpenStack Queens or later; this feature is enabled via
the neutron-api charm, with local configuration options
provided in the neutron-openvswitch charm.

The feature is only compatible with the openvswitch firewall
driver and will not be enabled if this configuration option
is not set in the neutron-openvswitch charm.

This change is removing unnecessary Neutron config
option "neutron_firewall_driver" since FW drivers are
being handled on agents side (not on API server) since
Mitaka release.

Change-Id: Icadb055b2c5c3216b6d086b44a4823595b2baffa
Closes-Bug: #1787397

commit_message:
Use virtualenv_path to set ansible_python_interpreter

Prior to Ansible 2.5 Jinja expansion was not supported in this variable.
Now that kayobe depends on 2.5, we can use the correct path.

Change-Id: I85f62ae80a8751a356cee5a56bc01493ae04d6f4
Story: 2002010
Task: 19648

commit_message:
Move example implementation to docs

This moves the example implementation from __main__.py to the docs
tree so it isn't confused for production code. A unit test is also
added to ensure that the example is kept up to date with any changes
in the API.

Change-Id: I92aa685f410ae0e56d5d55a15812edaae83c8ff1

The utsname can be set within the container, if it is set and lxc is

commit_message:
Add utsname to the hash of keys needing to be updated

The utsname can be set within the container, if it is set and lxc is
upgraded the container will fail to start after the upgrade. This change
corrects that issue.

Change-Id: I56473666c9517747fb2444d8ce1dcb16f69c9d4d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit abb1b6901fbe1600d1c7b654eb14378814f9df61)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-02-01 19:15:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-02-01 19:56:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

I think I'm on board with this. It reminds me of how odd it is to be calling get_*_info from middleware, though -- you have *no idea* what the app is actually going to get (assuming the request even makes it that far)!

Can we get some more docs on where ratelimit should go, though, and what should influence that decision?"}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-02-01 20:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I looked at the code and tried to find a creative way to develop a wildcard rate limiting (which this presumably would defeat), and came up with nothing. So, looks harmless.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-02-01 23:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-02-01 23:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-10-08 16:21:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-10-10 06:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 19:15:23.000000000', 'message': 'ratelimit: ignore requests with invalid API versions

If you've got things like domain_remap, swift3, or other such
middlewares in your pipeline, you wind up with requests that aren't of
the form "/v1/<account>/<container>/<object>". When encountering such
an oddball request, it's not useful to call get_account_info() on the
second path component since it's probably not an account.

This commit makes the ratelimit middleware skip requests that don't
start with either "/v1" or "/v1.0". The requests will still be
handled, but they won't be rate-limited.

Change-Id: I9980cd0e902610ac99d13a502ae955bca2d99df3
Closes-Bug: 1669888
'}, {'created': '2018-02-01 23:28:38.000000000', 'message': 'ratelimit: ignore requests with invalid API versions

If you've got things like domain_remap, swift3, or other such
middlewares in your pipeline, you wind up with requests that aren't of
the form "/v1/<account>/<container>/<object>". When encountering such
an oddball request, it's not useful to call get_account_info() on the
second path component since it's probably not an account.

This commit makes the ratelimit middleware skip requests that don't
start with either "/v1" or "/v1.0". The requests will still be
handled, but they won't be rate-limited.

Change-Id: I9980cd0e902610ac99d13a502ae955bca2d99df3
Closes-Bug: 1669888
Closes-Bug: 1695273
'}]
commit_message:
ratelimit: ignore requests with invalid API versions

If you've got things like domain_remap, swift3, or other such
middlewares in your pipeline, you wind up with requests that aren't of
the form "/v1/<account>/<container>/<object>". When encountering such
an oddball request, it's not useful to call get_account_info() on the
second path component since it's probably not an account.

This commit makes the ratelimit middleware skip requests that don't
start with either "/v1" or "/v1.0". The requests will still be
handled, but they won't be rate-limited.

Change-Id: I9980cd0e902610ac99d13a502ae955bca2d99df3
Closes-Bug: 1669888
Closes-Bug: 1695273

commit_message:
Parameterize dns server during ironic CI setup

A DNS server is needed in order to setup CI nodes for ironic, allow
it to be passed in for cases where 8.8.8.8 wont work. This reuses
DnsServers that may already be set in parameter_defaults.

Change-Id: I5fdc2a8d8bdde0b804827fd961381f7f7b7b1ce0

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I63fad8f1110702a12a3a84a34c34c46d800b06be
