commit_message:
Make fullstack and functional native Zuul v3 jobs

As part of the migration to Zuul v3 jobs should be converted to native
versions. This patch uses `devstack`'s native job to provide a base
for the functional and fullstack tests.

When backporting this commit a merge conflict ocurred. This was due to a
patch that imported zuul job settings from project-config [1] that was
done directly on the branch.

[1] a14955f4f6263583619e3cac3cc2c04511f12763

Change-Id: I2fb7e7e1a6c79c8e2edb0c0bff795d61881f2cd5
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539683/
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539686/
(cherry picked from commit 7cfbf343dce4522ddef59d29611e4f0cc718e4c4)

subject: Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 20:40:24.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I6a1ff10f9096e5e850e517313e261186a2c89654
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I6a1ff10f9096e5e850e517313e261186a2c89654

commit_message:
Fix log format for oxygen logging

the way karaf logs are enabled is changed in oxygen onwards,
due to which there are no logs getting saved on oxygen gate
jobs. This patch makes log format compatible enough to work
for all existing snapshots.

Change-Id: Id5636801fabb99c4d1d4dd54fb0754bbd7236049
(cherry picked from 65c1fba5f9c7d7c44b858562fdbd25465ba30fde)

commit_message:
Add support for native TLS encryption on NBD for disk migration

The NBD protocol previously runs in clear text, offering no security
protection for the data transferred, unless it is tunnelled over some
external transport like SSH. Such tunnelling is inefficient and
inconvenient to manage. Support for TLS to the NBD clients & servers
provided by QEMU was added. This adds support to configure ndb related
qemu.conf parameters.

Related-Bug: 1793093

Change-Id: I2c613faf55731af56735f8363b18e6c0e6185d9c

commit_message:
Move zuul_copy_output to be a job variable

The zuul_copy_output variable is designed to be able to be used as
a zuul job variable so that zuul dictionary merging will work. However,
it's currently being set in the playbook rather than as a job variable,
so it's not possible to supplement it in a child job.

Move it to be a job variable. Also remove the wrapping {} as they should
not be needed to make zuul_copy_output a dictionary.

Change-Id: I27da22bd48dbe7252db9f9d22f3087b070fb26ac
Depend-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539686/
(cherry picked from commit 277725b464549729ac2464944be6e5488823470d)

Use Zuul v3 fetch-subunit-output

Infra has consolidated the fetch output roles into one
fetch-subunit-output, this replaces usage of old roles with new one.

commit_message:
Add database access details to UpgradeCommands docstring

Per the original Nova code, these checks need to be able to run on
n-1 database data, so they can't rely on the service's object model
for database access. Add details about that to the docstring for
UpgradeCommands.

Also removes a nova-ism from the check docstring.

Change-Id: I4fe84988397ae9bd2305811f10fa3d1449c4ac9f

commit_message:
tighten API for main()

Have the caller set up any of their options before passing a
ConfigOpts instance to main() and then let main() take over processing
from there.

Change the check callback argument to take an UpgradeCommands instance
so in the future if there are more commands we can get the callbacks
out of it ourself.

Add a default_config_files option to main() so that applications can
pass locations oslo.config won't find by default.

Change 'category' to 'command'.

Use a closure in _register_cli_options instead of a separate function
that requires a partial.

Change-Id: Ic4f25fd23d424acfcfe185a85bb63abf7d25c39e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Improve config handling

Many projects need a specific config object (usually the global one)
populated for project code that relies on it. Additionally, we want
to make the code used to initialize the object overrideable so projects
can use their existing code for that. The primary benefit is that
project code has sane defaults for config file locations so in many
cases it won't be necessary to explicitly specify the location. A
very simple default implementation is also provided so the module
still works out of the box too.

Change-Id: If8ce7202bd73793688a0446f069bb4e03547c99e

commit_message:
remove warnings from using deprecated methods of Sphinx application

Use the sphinx wrapper around logging instead of app.info().

Add a -v option to sphinx-build to see the output.

Change-Id: Ia698929c252a2a19da812e399011341a41976540
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
nova: tag ocata-em

This applies the "ocata-em" tag to the final ocata
release which puts the stable/ocata branch into
extended maintenance mode [1][2].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180301-stable-branch-eol.html

Change-Id: I36aca7169b137a20613acb1218c03994320a5434

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 08:21:47.000000000', 'message': "Removing the fullstack tests

As discussed on the IRC meeting [1], these tests have no value and are
100% failing all the time now.
Additionally in the stadium requirements [2] there's no requirement to
have these tests.

It makes no sense to keep them as such.

Additionally, networking_odl/tests/contrib directory is removed.
At first glance it contained mentions of fullstack which needed updated,
but upon further research it was found that the files in it weren't used
so it's removed altogether.

[1] https://meetings.opendaylight.org/opendaylight-neutron/2018/weekly_meeting/opendaylight-neutron-weekly_meeting.2018-07-30-15.03.txt
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/stadium/governance.html#when-is-a-project-considered-part-of-the-stadium

Change-Id: I0c78abb3157a7813b87de168bfb39cab2e56d725

commit_message:
Removing the fullstack tests

As discussed on the IRC meeting [1], these tests have no value and are
100% failing all the time now.
Additionally in the stadium requirements [2] there's no requirement to
have these tests.

It makes no sense to keep them as such.

Additionally, networking_odl/tests/contrib directory is removed.
At first glance it contained mentions of fullstack which needed updated,
but upon further research it was found that the files in it weren't used
so it's removed altogether.

[1] https://meetings.opendaylight.org/opendaylight-neutron/2018/weekly_meeting/opendaylight-neutron-weekly_meeting.2018-07-30-15.03.txt
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/stadium/governance.html#when-is-a-project-considered-part-of-the-stadium

Change-Id: I0c78abb3157a7813b87de168bfb39cab2e56d725
(cherry picked from commit 2e6f60ccabf4379cf4db3362889438b42e0959c9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 16:10:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix inspector dnsmasq interface name

Kolla-ansible uses the variable 'ironic_dnsmasq_interface' to denote the
interface for the ironic inspector dnsmasq service. Previously kayobe
was incorrectly using the variable 'inspector_dnsmasq_interface', which
caused kolla-ansible to ignore it and use the API interface instead.
This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I733a84759cd03b62659dbf2d7027b7be9e42e818
Story: 2004026
Task: 27017
"}]
commit_message:
Fix inspector dnsmasq interface name

Kolla-ansible uses the variable 'ironic_dnsmasq_interface' to denote the
interface for the ironic inspector dnsmasq service. Previously kayobe
was incorrectly using the variable 'inspector_dnsmasq_interface', which
caused kolla-ansible to ignore it and use the API interface instead.
This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I733a84759cd03b62659dbf2d7027b7be9e42e818
Story: 2004026
Task: 27017

commit_message:
Update log metrics config for Logstash downgrade

The format for the Logstash Kafka output plugin worker count is
integer in Logstash 2 and string in Logstash 5. Since we have downgraded
Logstash we need to switch formats here.

Change-Id: I98113dda05bbb44410916c27d7d3bcd59a034a98
Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles

commit_message:
Support using binary Logstash image

To build the Monasca images, they need to be built from source, however,
this doesn't include Logstash. Logstash does not differentiate between
binary or source install types, so we can just use the default.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: I7eb355f25864f2b993780cd2b000c8bcd13f78e8

commit_message:
Update Monasca Log Transformer config

* Convert all log levels to lowercase
* Make number of threads configurable
* Improve naming
* Update path and log options for Logstash 2.4
* Change worker count from string to integer for the Kafka output plugin supplied
  with Logstash 2.4.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: I9379969ee639dff0b525d7a1a03df59bcf18b98b

commit_message:
Increase maximum payload size for Monasca Log API

Increase the maximum payload size so that it slightly exceeds the default
maximum chunk size (8MB) in Fluentd. This prevents the Monasca Log API
dropping logs when under heavy load.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: I13020abde7de1c92acc07352466b814b4a6ce5bc

commit_message:
turn off ara install and cfg in multinode

Multiple versions of ansible are causing jobs
to fail in the upstream gate. Let's ensure it's
working correctly before enabling upstream

Related-Bug: #1795009
Depends-On: Ie9f5d3b6380caa6824ca940ca48ed0fcf6308608
Change-Id: I367cd9afac400fc277d5c6b7b455fafe1725169a

commit_message:
Prevent Monasca Notification using YAML mode

If the config option is not specified Monasca Notification defaults
to YAML config parsing and fails to load.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: Id85d9765df525b34d43a77a9e4045e0de19aef99

commit_message:
Update configuration files to match install-guide

* auth_uri has become www_authenticate_uri
  See:
  * openstack/glance git repo:
    Change-Id: I1de0272fb7c20b8efa710d984ff8196c41b30b6b
  * openstack/cinder git repo:
    Change-Id: I2a9853b52f23fc4b6a24a0548b9749e976467758
  * openstack/neutron git repo:
    Change-Id: I97356b31af35ef19d02b9f0c0a57cbde16752c65

* os_region_name -> region_name (the old name is still used in the
  default configuration file; we change it with sed until it is fixed
  upstream)
  See:
  * openstack/nova git repo:
    Update the deprecate os_region_name option
    Change-Id: Id44d456bb1bdb0c5564ad4f5d9cdee2f41226052
    commit d163fb6d697d74ea93ffc394187871a3a8c4ccd8

* a couple of other, minor changes

Change-Id: I74fe0982bdd21ad595657eb450cf317cb59405da
(cherry picked from commit 79a4a41bb6b2ec9bb797c743b6359b40195510d3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:54:04.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia0c9884ea6c20553d2b4da8b0668b64b53ace41f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-09 16:48:36.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia0c9884ea6c20553d2b4da8b0668b64b53ace41f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia0c9884ea6c20553d2b4da8b0668b64b53ace41f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Minimal(ist) network config for nspawn gating

Nspawn containers can attach directly to the physical host interface
using macvlan which allows us to greatly simplify connectivity in test
instances.

Changes to the user variable files have been made to allow the services
to function on a simplified stack.

Depends-On: I083042a791d9213b9b1872a239dc18dc6c7ae46e
Change-Id: Iaa7cfb051d26bcd080df15ef8949d3cf16208ea9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4a07e2612e1841865ed998d33fd3d1cbdc6cf4e5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-12 21:35:45.000000000', 'message': 'Handle requirements set to empty strings

If hypervisor_properties or resource_properties are set to empty strings
by the API client, they are persisted as empty strings in the database.
However, in convert_requirements(), the code assumes they are JSON
strings and tries to parse them, which raises a MalformedRequirements
exception.

This can be triggered by the operator when updating an extra capability
on a node that is reserved with resource_properties set to an empty
string, as is_updatable_extra_capability() calls convert_requirements.
Blazar would return a 400 Client Error to them.

Ideally, only valid JSON should be persisted to the database. However,
this will require an Alembic migration to change existing empty strings
to empty JSON arrays. In the meantime, this simpler patch can be
backported to stable branches.

Change-Id: Ic6d18418a2515cd37bbeed25ee3ab8c360624ca3
Closes-Bug: #1792245
'}, {'created': '2018-09-13 17:36:07.000000000', 'message': 'Handle requirements set to empty strings

If hypervisor_properties or resource_properties are set to empty strings
by the API client, they are persisted as empty strings in the database.
However, in convert_requirements(), the code assumes they are JSON
strings and tries to parse them, which raises a MalformedRequirements
exception.

This can be triggered by an operator when updating an extra capability
on a node that is reserved with resource_properties set to an empty
string, as is_updatable_extra_capability() calls convert_requirements().
Blazar would return a 400 Client Error to them.

Ideally, only valid JSON should be persisted to the database. However,
this will require an Alembic migration to change existing empty strings
to empty JSON arrays. In the meantime, this simpler patch can be
backported to stable branches.

Change-Id: Ic6d18418a2515cd37bbeed25ee3ab8c360624ca3
Closes-Bug: #1792245
'}]
commit_message:
Handle requirements set to empty strings

If hypervisor_properties or resource_properties are set to empty strings
by the API client, they are persisted as empty strings in the database.
However, in convert_requirements(), the code assumes they are JSON
strings and tries to parse them, which raises a MalformedRequirements
exception.

This can be triggered by an operator when updating an extra capability
on a node that is reserved with resource_properties set to an empty
string, as is_updatable_extra_capability() calls convert_requirements().
Blazar would return a 400 Client Error to them.

Ideally, only valid JSON should be persisted to the database. However,
this will require an Alembic migration to change existing empty strings
to empty JSON arrays. In the meantime, this simpler patch can be
backported to stable branches.

Change-Id: Ic6d18418a2515cd37bbeed25ee3ab8c360624ca3
Closes-Bug: #1792245

commit_message:
Move heat domain setup into service setup tasks

The heat domain setup tasks use the old keystone plugin.
In this patch we switch it to using the ansible modules
instead, and move the tasks into the same place as all
the other tasks doing similar things.

Change-Id: Idcb79f43ab33b58829e6a07a2c2c13774ed3148b

commit_message:
Fix nic_alias fact error

If os-net-config is not installed, this fact causes a warning to be
generated. Let's check for os-net-config prior to trying to run it to
cleanup this error.

Change-Id: Ie55b96bbd7b60dae2342b89c24936d4d071cec10
Closes-Bug: #1794837

[{'created': '2018-09-28 13:31:47.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary distro package installs

There appears to be no need for the openstack packages
to be installed by this role, especially given that
they conflict with the installs done by the utility
playbook when doing a source-based install.

Also, the other packages in the list appear to be a
remnant of the past. It appears that neither 'which'
or 'rsync' are used in the role through shell commands
or ansible modules.

Change-Id: Ib757dd2616f6d6aa6ebc6b870b76b3fa2ac7c8f6
(cherry picked from commit 7dcb2c7f008509967feed49ff0951c3b25c03b50)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary distro package installs

There appears to be no need for the openstack packages
to be installed by this role, especially given that
they conflict with the installs done by the utility
playbook when doing a source-based install.

Also, the other packages in the list appear to be a
remnant of the past. It appears that neither 'which'
or 'rsync' are used in the role through shell commands
or ansible modules.

Change-Id: Ib757dd2616f6d6aa6ebc6b870b76b3fa2ac7c8f6
(cherry picked from commit 7dcb2c7f008509967feed49ff0951c3b25c03b50)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 13:53:34.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I6ee01703bd4c432211f0d6e2f3501c989523ae11
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I6ee01703bd4c432211f0d6e2f3501c989523ae11

(2 comments)

Greetings, what I see looks fairly good, although we need some more REST API tests, and it looks like we're missing a key piece which would be the value actually being used for the determination of if automated cleaning should take place. I believe that would be entirely limited to conductor.py, and I think we can go-ahead and land that in this change as well, especially since we're advertising support in the release note.

Additionally, the patch series needs to be rebased.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-08-13 08:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2018-08-13 08:18:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Implement LDAP domains using last keystone host

To ensure that the domains can be created, we only execute
the tasks on the last member of the keystone_all group so
that the load balancer has at least one other host to work
against.

We also replace the OSA keystone module in the task with
the standard Ansible module, and delegate the task to the
service setup host.

Change-Id: I66ed21cdcf42d0c2012062c8cf74305fecbec312

commit_message:
Fix assess status for super-conductor

In a cells deployment its possible that the top-level
nova-cloud-controller will have no compute nodes associated with it.
This change fixes the work load status in that scenario.

There is also a drive by fix to return empty contexts for the cell
db and amqp contexts if the relation do not yet exists.

Change-Id: Ia8eeccb6794dd016185eb0cfb05339b76cef9348

[{'created': '2018-09-19 11:02:04.000000000', 'message': 'Deploy Sahara with unversioned endpoints

Sahara supports unversioned endpoint also for the stable API v1.1,

commit_message:
Deploy Sahara with unversioned endpoints

Sahara supports unversioned endpoint also for the stable API v1.1,
and this is a requirement in order to use the experimental API v2.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582285/ for more details.

Following the pattern used for other services with unversioned
endpoints, the sahara_service_*uri variables are directly and all
sahara_service_*url can thus be removed.

Closes-Bug: #1782147
Change-Id: I2d4477de6a3ad58fe58152b18e18a9a6dffdafd4
(cherry picked from commit 98c27423a9fdf22636eb7ec0e5a57a258e622dba)

commit_message:
Remove task which was for P-Q upgrade

This task did not get removed with its companion task,
so we remove it now as it's no longer useful.

Change-Id: I8507ee5147b2226a2eaf9ba8f8fb56065aa1aeb1

commit_message:
Use a virtualenv for remote operations by default

The docker python module fails to install without a virtualenv with
pip10.  The following error is seen in the task Ensure docker SDK for
python is installed:

Cannot uninstall 'ipaddress'. It is a distutils installed project and
thus we cannot accurately determine which files belong to it which would
lead to only a partial uninstall

This is fixed by using a remote Python virtual environment for executing
Kayobe Ansible tasks in the default Kayobe configuration.

Change-Id: I1348e428d736f93c76316c7fb5f2708b99554eb3
Story: 2002010
Task: 19648

[{'created': '2018-10-09 03:25:43.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I97019542009784ff81b565b6936be6774f2557f1
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I97019542009784ff81b565b6936be6774f2557f1

commit_message:
Disable apparmor for openSUSE distros

Dnsmasq and haproxy are used frequently by neutron and nova, apparmor
profiles can block some operations and the deployed cloud can't
work properly so some tests are going to fail.

Some openSUSE distros has apparmor enabled by default so we need to
disable it.

Change-Id: I30fda684effb09810643e58bf0b31a73d7d9b378
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:50:39.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If0ee6818a04526c1035dbe303a278d1176344166
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If0ee6818a04526c1035dbe303a278d1176344166
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Gate: refactor gate script running

This is the 1st in a series of commits to reduce the complexity
of the gate playbooks, follow on work will target gates more
specificly to both reduce infra load and improve coverage.

This PS also removes the unused ldap-deploy playbook.

Change-Id: Ie4ddabe86d71008611c6cc5015a927e32c54fa35
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

subject: nova: Configure discover_hosts_in_cells_interval for multi-host
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-08 15:22:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-10-08 16:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Why exactly?

This interval was basically a hack for ironic deployments that didn't have discoverable nodes until after ironic resources were enrolled and exposed. I think that now that we can discover by service this is largely unnecessary in most cases. For devstack, it would only be a thing for multinode setups, which are very much the exception.

Is there some real situation that brought this up? Barring one, I think I'm -1 on just enabling this "because."'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-08 16:51:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Why exactly?
 > 
 > This interval was basically a hack for ironic deployments that
 > didn't have discoverable nodes until after ironic resources were
 > enrolled and exposed. I think that now that we can discover by
 > service this is largely unnecessary in most cases. For devstack, it
 > would only be a thing for multinode setups, which are very much the
 > exception.
 > 
 > Is there some real situation that brought this up? Barring one, I
 > think I'm -1 on just enabling this "because."

As noted in the commit message

> Deploy a multi-host configuration and try to boot an instance and
> you'll be greeted with the following:
>
>   Host 'foo' is not mapped to any cell.
>
> The solution, as noted in the nova docs [1], is clear: either run
> 'nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts' on the controller or configure
> '[scheduler] discover_hosts_in_cells_interval' so that nova will do this
> for us. For the sanity of our users, let's do the latter.

So it's not "because" but rather because it seemed like the more automatic of the two methods of the the docs tell me I can and should use to resolve my issue. If this option is a hack then I can call out the need to run nova-manage in the multi-host doc instead, but the option should really be marked as advanced in nova, it should have it's hackiness mentioned as part of the option help text and that document should not tell people to use it. I can fix all of these but only if it's a hack (I don't know)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-10-08 17:08:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It's definitely a hack, IMHO. We added it for ironic because they had a bunch of sequencing problems without it. Then with it, they still had problems because of the inherent raciness of needing to basically wait 2*interval before trying anything that assumed the hosts were up. After adding the by-service approach, they were finally able to have a repeatable process, and IIRC, tripleo removed the use of the periodic as a result.

Especially given the "why doesn't my ... oh, 30s later it does, hmm" behavior that people would experience, I'd much rather have it in the multinode docs explicitly.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-10-08 17:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Some context: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1755602'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-09 15:58:02.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Turns out it's already called out and I  simply ignored it

> Once the compute node services shows up, run the ./tools/discover_hosts.sh script from the control node to map compute hosts to the single cell.

Moving onto the nova docs work."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 15:22:47.000000000', 'message': "nova: Configure discover_hosts_in_cells_interval for multi-host

Deploy a multi-host configuration and try to boot an instance and you'll
be greeted with the following:

  Host 'foo' is not mapped to any cell.

The solution, as noted in the nova docs [1], is clear: either run
'nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts' on the controller or configure
'[scheduler] discover_hosts_in_cells_interval' so that nova will do this
for us. For the sanity of our users, let's do the latter.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/user/cells.html#fresh-install

Change-Id: I75f41d2633b751977b12eda6fccae9521dabd0be
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
nova: Configure discover_hosts_in_cells_interval for multi-host

Deploy a multi-host configuration and try to boot an instance and you'll
be greeted with the following:

  Host 'foo' is not mapped to any cell.

The solution, as noted in the nova docs [1], is clear: either run
'nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts' on the controller or configure
'[scheduler] discover_hosts_in_cells_interval' so that nova will do this
for us. For the sanity of our users, let's do the latter.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/user/cells.html#fresh-install

Change-Id: I75f41d2633b751977b12eda6fccae9521dabd0be
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I40bd602eb3896af881906a95a5652b740577f85e

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:54:14.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idcae652e95cbfbe5f8d0fece4bd974b3e452b297
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idcae652e95cbfbe5f8d0fece4bd974b3e452b297
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

For example db_get_val('Bridge', self.br_name, 'controller') will return [] if there are no controllers, but None if the bridge isn't created. commit_message:
Don't error out if db_get_val returns None

db_get_val() can return None, so it isn't safe to iterate over the
output w/o handling that case.

Closes-Bug: #1796898
Change-Id: I6f99ab7c17edf1893b4fd45a2724a1db95c15e81

commit_message:
Allow Juju AZ context information to be used

The change adds an option to the charm to use JUJU_AVAILABILITY_ZONE
environment variable set by Juju for the hook environment based on the
underlying provider's availability zone information for a given machine.

This information is used to configure default_availability_zone for nova
and availability_zone for subordinate networking charms.

Change-Id: Idc7112e7fe7b76d15cf9c4896b702b8ffd8c0e8e
Closes-Bug: #1796068

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 08:33:47.000000000', 'message': "Remove apt-cacher-ng

The repo container's package cache causes quite a bit of confusion
given that it's a 'hidden' feature which catches deployers off-guard
when they already have their own cache configured. This is really
the kind of service which people should manage outside of OSA. It
also makes no sense if the deployer is using their own local mirror
which is a fairly common practise. Adding to that, it seems that it
is broken in bionic, causing massive delays in package installs.
Finally, it also adds to quite a bit of complexity due to the fact
that it's in a container - so in the playbooks prior to the container's
existence we have to detect whether it's there and add/remove the config
accordingly.

Let's just remove it and let deployers managing their own caching
infrastructure if they want it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/608631
Change-Id: Ia0fb41266a6d62073b02c8ad6fa97b8b7d408a67
(cherry picked from commit 43a5c874ef7ff1c43c51086022655bb44492794e)

commit_message:
Remove apt-cacher-ng

The repo container's package cache causes quite a bit of confusion
given that it's a 'hidden' feature which catches deployers off-guard
when they already have their own cache configured. This is really
the kind of service which people should manage outside of OSA. It
also makes no sense if the deployer is using their own local mirror
which is a fairly common practise. Adding to that, it seems that it
is broken in bionic, causing massive delays in package installs.
Finally, it also adds to quite a bit of complexity due to the fact
that it's in a container - so in the playbooks prior to the container's
existence we have to detect whether it's there and add/remove the config
accordingly.

Let's just remove it and let deployers managing their own caching
infrastructure if they want it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/608880
Change-Id: Ia0fb41266a6d62073b02c8ad6fa97b8b7d408a67
(cherry picked from commit 43a5c874ef7ff1c43c51086022655bb44492794e)

Purge python- packages on upgrade.

commit_message:
nova: do not verify standard resource classes when using ironic

Starting with the Stein series, the ironic virt driver no longer exposes
the standard VCPU/MEMORY/DISK resource classes. If for any reason the
inventory for them is created on the Rocky side of grenade, the verification
phase fails after upgrading to Stein. This breaks ironic-inspector CI.

This patch updates the logic to check for a custom resource class.

Change-Id: I265046d1615a34f55836264ea8f6ce72d32391cf

[{'created': '2018-09-14 21:15:21.000000000', 'message': 'Disable SSH password authentication during tripleo-admin enablement.

SSH password authentication is now disabled when injecting the temporary
SSH key during the tripleo-admin user enablement. This change will cause
the SSH command to fail quickly if the key is rejected instead of appearing
to hang at a password prompt which is never displayed to the user.

Change-Id: I7b746b2033c217e78c3d9942995de1479a728943
Closes-Bug: #1792641
'}]
commit_message:
Disable SSH password authentication during tripleo-admin enablement.

SSH password authentication is now disabled when injecting the temporary
SSH key during the tripleo-admin user enablement. This change will cause
the SSH command to fail quickly if the key is rejected instead of appearing
to hang at a password prompt which is never displayed to the user.

Change-Id: I7b746b2033c217e78c3d9942995de1479a728943
Closes-Bug: #1792641

commit_message:
Check mode support for hiera deployments

Add check mode support for hiera deployments. Additionally, when running
under check mode, also support diff mode (--diff), which will show a
diff of the changes to any existing hieradata files or hiera
configuration file.

Change-Id: Ibe0c2ab79c35f04ce51e7a1ade0e8ff72b430163

commit_message:
Mark CoreOS check jobs non-voting

Due to a higher failure rate, which is largely due
to nested virtualization failures with CoreOS where
one or more of the CI infrastucture providers do not
support nested virtualization, we are marking the
CoreOS CI check jobs as non-voting. This is in order
to reduce the need to recheck.

Change-Id: Id2a5dc766b79ec1131e33f9a49ceca8095c363ef
Story: #2003985
Task: #26928

messages:
[{'account_id': 29267, 'date': '2018-10-09 12:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-10-09 12:51:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-09 13:29:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Please follow the Creator's guide completely, it is at http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html

Especially:
* Add a change to add the repo to Zuul

Also, please update the commit message to explain what flare is and how it fits into OpenStack ecosystem."}, {'account_id': 29267, 'date': '2018-10-09 14:15:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add openstack/flare project. Flare is a service for running and scheduling burstable task resources. Typical job is unlimited scientific batch from multiple teams with multiple priorities, which runs on limited compute resources (GPUs for example).

Change-Id: Ic5c7c925d799ae276d4273f9d7e23e345d092c75

commit_message:
[upstream] Remove Tags

This patch removes the tags table from the site and tags from the
slides. Since the content has moved out of the slides and into the
contributor guide, the tags are not really useful anymore. Moreover,
they weren't being maintained as new slide decks were added anyway.

Change-Id: I7f10d47364e3792177e34f915280c2ae025d65d9

commit_message:
Add scheduler workers support

The configuration option scheduler/workers was added
in Rocky [1]. This patch adds the nova::scheduler::workers
parameter which can be used to set this new config option.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/rocky.html

Change-Id: I217444b2c30d62347cd9e25def769e94d12a70fc

messages: [{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-05 13:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-05 16:33:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nAll of the required projects end up in LIBS_FROM_GIT so as long as nothing in those stable branches is assuming that everything in LIBS_FROM_GIT can/should be installed this should be fine.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-05 17:37:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-10-09 13:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-09 13:43:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-05 13:54:56.000000000', 'message': "Add openstack/placement to legacy-dsvm-base required-projects

Devstack will need the openstack/placement repo starting in Stein
so this adds it to the legacy-dsvm-base required-projects list.
The repo doesn't exist on stable branches before Stein so if zuulv3
checks it out in stable branch job runs it should just be ignored.

Needed by https://review.openstack.org/600162/

Change-Id: Ieeb586f538ecd9d4cbbaabd605825e4c5f06ff63
"}]
commit_message:
Add openstack/placement to legacy-dsvm-base required-projects

Devstack will need the openstack/placement repo starting in Stein
so this adds it to the legacy-dsvm-base required-projects list.
The repo doesn't exist on stable branches before Stein so if zuulv3
checks it out in stable branch job runs it should just be ignored.

Needed by https://review.openstack.org/600162/

Change-Id: Ieeb586f538ecd9d4cbbaabd605825e4c5f06ff63

commit_message:
Enable FWaaS panel for OpenStack Rocky or later

Install the neutron-fwaas-dashboard package at Rocky; this is the
first release that this dashboard is packaged for and co-incides
with the switch to using Python 3 for Horizon itself.

Change-Id: I0522bd20b8f6f707c3f69b88313d9b0aa129af07

commit_message:
Refactor _validate_instance_group_policy to be a context manager

This refactor is in preparation for change Ie53bcd74, which requires
_validate_instance_group_policy to be able to do some cleanup after a
build completes.

Related-Bug: #1763181
Change-Id: I2ba42f54e4f64190bf8c28449995bae21bcb3543

messages:
[{'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-10-05 00:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-10-08 14:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-10-09 07:24:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Generally the change looks OK but you need to update templates later than mitaka as well (tree templates for scope).  I'd probably also just add the required AGENT section to the neutron.conf file - then if new agents appear in future releases, we get free zone configuration!"}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-10-09 09:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

OK so

1) Switch to using neutron.conf with an [AGENT] section for zone configuration so all agents can use this setting and

2) Just fold into the existing NeutronGatewayContext - find to add another key here rather than use a whole new class'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-10-09 10:25:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-10-09 10:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-10-09 13:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-05 00:53:43.000000000', 'message': "Allow Juju AZ context information to be used

The change adds an option to the charm to use JUJU_AVAILABILITY_ZONE
environment variable set by Juju for the hook environment based on the
underlying provider's availability zone information for a given machine.

This information is used to configure the availability_zone setting for
Neutron agents (DHCP and L3 agent).

Additionally, a setting is added to allow changing the default
availability zone because 'nova' is a default value coming from the
Neutron defaults for agents.

Change-Id: I94303aa70ee3adc6ace0f9af1e7c4f5c0edbcdb5
Closes-Bug: #1796068
"}, {'created': '2018-10-08 14:56:30.000000000', 'message': "Allow Juju AZ context information to be used

Neutron DHCP and L3 agents specifically because they support it
and for other agents (because both neutron.conf and agent-specific
configuration files are loaded) such as metadata agents and lbaas
agents.

Additionally, a setting is added to allow changing the default
availability zone because 'nova' is a default value coming from the
Neutron defaults for agents.

Change-Id: I94303aa70ee3adc6ace0f9af1e7c4f5c0edbcdb5
Closes-Bug: #1796068
"}]
commit_message:
Allow Juju AZ context information to be used

The change adds an option to the charm to use JUJU_AVAILABILITY_ZONE
environment variable set by Juju for the hook environment based on the
underlying provider's availability zone information for a given machine.

This information is used to configure the availability_zone setting for
Neutron DHCP and L3 agents specifically because they support it
and for other agents (because both neutron.conf and agent-specific
configuration files are loaded) such as metadata agents and lbaas
agents.

Additionally, a setting is added to allow changing the default
availability zone because 'nova' is a default value coming from the
Neutron defaults for agents.

Change-Id: I94303aa70ee3adc6ace0f9af1e7c4f5c0edbcdb5
Closes-Bug: #1796068

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 20:03:41.000000000', 'message': 'Revert vmware-nsx to previous release

There is no tag for what is currently in its pike stable branch in git
and no release on pypi.

renderspec fetch_source and obs service download_files have different
caching behaviour and both are in use. So stable URLs like
vmware-nsx-stable-pike.tar.gz with changing content will not work. The
CI will not update the file that is used to build but the version in the
rendered spec is updated.

Revert "Use stable/pike sources for vmware-nsx"

This reverts commit f900fc198e72137cae86da77743a141b9850b62c.

Change-Id: Ifa7a9745984f1c73735deab857af0fe33446c075

rendered spec is updated.

Change-Id: Ifa7a9745984f1c73735deab857af0fe33446c075

commit_message:
Use basename filter for vmware-nsx

There is no tag for what is currently in its pike stable branch in git
and no release on pypi.

renderspec fetch_source and obs service download_files have different
caching behaviour and both are in use. So stable URLs like
vmware-nsx-stable-pike.tar.gz with changing content will not work. The
CI will not update the file that is used to build but the version in the
rendered spec is updated.

Change-Id: Ifa7a9745984f1c73735deab857af0fe33446c075

messages:
[{'account_id': 29138, 'date': '2018-09-18 10:41:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-09-18 10:41:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2018-09-18 11:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-09-18 21:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-09-25 00:18:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-10-02 13:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2018-10-08 15:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-09 12:56:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1
